snippet: Matt Cain of the San Francisco Giants, who is 9-3 with a 2.62 earned run average this season, will be the starting pitcher for the National League All-Stars, ahead of the Mets' R.A. Dickey (12-1, 2.40).
abstract: Matt Cain of the San Francisco Giants, who is 9-3 with a 2.62 earned run average this season, will be the starting pitcher for the National League All-Stars, ahead of the Mets' R.A. Dickey (12-1, 2.40).

headline.main: Matt Cain, Not Dickey, to Start All-Star Game
headline.print_headline: With Posey Catching, La Russa Chooses Cain Over Dickey as Starter
